channel.title: Times of India Tech: Latest IT, telecom, Internet, BPO news and updates
channel.description: Visit Times of india Tech for everything about IT jobs, gadgets, Web 2.0 apps, blogs, social networking, wireless platforms like 3G, WiFi, VOIP; and updates on outsourcing to India

image.title: Times of India Tech: Latest IT, telecom, Internet, BPO news and updates

item.title: BlackBerry selling most Canadian real estate
item.description: BlackBerry is selling most of its real estate holdings in Canada.

item.title: iPhone may get ‘intelligent’ battery management system
item.description: It seems Apple is finally working on a way to increase the battery backup offered by its premium smartphone.

item.title: ​Samsung Galaxy 'S5 Neo' leaked
item.description: A user agent profile for an unannounced Samsung smartphone has been spotted on the company’s servers.

item.title: Lenovo buys Unwired Planet's 3G, 4G patents
item.description: Unwired Planet said it sold a portfolio of patents to Chinese technology company Lenovo for $100 million in cash.

item.title: Twitter starts weekly stats newsletter for users
item.description: Twitter wants to offer more information to its users about how they use the social network and the way their followers engage with them.

item.title: Twitter starts weekly stats newsletter for users
item.description: Twitter wants to offer more information to its users about how they use the social network and the way their followers engage with them.

item.title: Google unveils new desktop maps for Indian cities
item.description: Google has unveiled a new tool to search, navigate and explore Indian cities, streets, landmarks and restaurants through desktop maps.

item.title: FireChat with anyone sans mobile signals
item.description: FireChat is an app that lets you chat with anyone in your vicinity, even without a mobile or internet connection.

item.title: FireChat with anyone sans mobile signals
item.description: FireChat is an app that lets you chat with anyone in your vicinity, even without a mobile or internet connection.

item.title: Seagate chief Steve Luczo exits Microsoft board
item.description: Microsoft said that Steve Luczo has stepped down from its board to focus on his job as chief executive of digital storage firm Seagate.

item.title: Apple's new patent hints at stylus for iPad
item.description: Apple's latest patent is titled simply "Input Device Having Extendable Nib," which could be the long-awaited iStylus.

item.title: Marissa Mayer can’t work Alibaba’s magic for long
item.description: Yahoo CEO, who has overseen an almost 150% stock rally fueled by her company’s stake in Alibaba, is poised to pare that ownership.

item.title: Twitter now supports in-line video playback
item.description: Twitter has rolled out a new platform that will allow content providers to host videos.

item.title: India fastest growing for MS cloud business, but won’t have a data centre for now
item.description: Microsoft India chairman Bhaskar Pramanik said India was the fastest growing market for its cloud business Azure and Office 365 apps.

item.title: India fastest growing for MS cloud business, but won’t have a data centre for now
item.description: Microsoft India chairman Bhaskar Pramanik said India was the fastest growing market for its cloud business Azure and Office 365 apps.

item.title: Tribune mobile app creates 'playlists' of streaming audio news
item.description: New Tribune mobile app creates 'playlists' of streaming audio news.

item.title: Tribune mobile app creates 'playlists' of streaming audio news
item.description: New Tribune mobile app creates 'playlists' of streaming audio news.

item.title: ‘Micromax may consider public listing if next govt is stable’
item.description: Micromax is considering a public listing in 2014 — nearly three years after it withdrew an initial share sale.

item.title: JPMorgan questions Narayana Murthy’s claim on attrition
item.description: The head of business operations at Infosys has resigned in a move that was anticipated but which shone the spotlight again on the company’s struggles with senior management exits.

item.title: Twitter turns 8: What was your first tweet?
item.description: To celebrate its eighth anniversary, Twitter has decided to take its users on a little trip down memory lane by launching #FirstTweet.

item.title: Twitter turns 8: What was your first tweet?
item.description: To celebrate its eighth anniversary, Twitter has decided to take its users on a little trip down memory lane by launching #FirstTweet.

item.title: Samsung NX Mini, a camera for selfie lovers
item.description: Samsung is set to launch NX Mini, a mirrorless camera with interchangeable-lens system that focuses on looks, small size and selfies.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S5 pre-orders begin in US
item.description: AT&T says it will take orders for Samsung's new Galaxy S5 smartphone starting Friday, while T-Mobile will start on Monday.

item.title: Google revs up home delivery with cars, drivers
item.description: For Google, dispatching drivers and delivering packages seems like an expensive diversion with an uncertain payoff.

item.title: Obama may dump BlackBerry for Android
item.description: The White House is conducting security tests for several smartphones, including those of Samsung and LG, for internal use.
